channel.title: Do Won Kim
channel.description: Recent content on Do Won Kim

item.title: Integrating Zotero and Obsidian for Zettelkasten
item.description: Tutorial for INST800 at UMD iSchool

item.title: Curation of Reading Lists
item.description: This is a curation of reading lists that are relevant to my research interests.

item.title: Smile to Win : How do Candidates' Smiles Affect Election Outcomes?
item.description: How do candidates’ appearance affect election outcomes? This study investigates the effect of smiles on vote shares using election posters of candidates running in South Korean local elections.

item.title: Strategic Allocation of Political Fund and Re-election of Incumbents in South Korea
item.description: This paper investigates how different patterns of political fund spending are related to the odds of being re-election based on the 19th and 20th legislators' expenditures of political funds.

item.title: Voting against in the 2017 French presidential election
item.description: Do voters vote for the candidate they like or vote against their dislike? This paper aims to broaden the understanding of voting behavior and expand the scope of voting models by incorporating loss aversion, the central concept of the prospect theory, into the traditional proximity model.

item.title: Muting low-quality sources: A field experiment to mitigate the harm of inaccurate health information online
item.description: Overview The template produces an academic presentation using LaTeX with the Beamer class . The presentation carefully follows typographical best practices and has a minimalist design. The goal is to produce slides that convey information as effectively as possible—complementing the talk, not distracting from it. Download LaTeX template for academic presentations Presentation obtained from the template Features The aspect ratio is set to 4:3. There are no frills at the periphery of the slides.
